case_title: MUHAMMAD HASHIM vs PRESIDING OFFICER and 6 others

accussed_details.name: Muhammad Hashim
allegation: Quashment of proceedings pending before the Special Court (Offences in Banks) Sindh at Karachi

complaint_summary: Petition filed for quashment of proceedings arising out of F.I.R. No.1/2001 and challenge to trial court jurisdiction.
investigation_summary: Petitioner invoked trial court jurisdiction for acquittal and filed application under section 249-A, Cr.P.C., which remains undecided.
judgment_summary: The Sindh High Court directed the trial court to decide the jurisdictional point and application under section 249-A, Cr.P.C. within one month. Petition disposed of accordingly.
Decision_or_verdict: Petition disposed of with directions to trial court.
legal_arguments: Application under section 249-A, Cr.P.C. for acquittal.

legal_terms.Quashment: The act of nullifying or voiding a legal proceeding.
legal_terms.Jurisdiction: The authority of a court to hear and decide a case.

words_and_phrases.Adequate remedy: A sufficient legal solution available to the petitioner.

summary_vector_notes: Petition filed for quashment of proceedings and jurisdictional challenge. Sindh High Court directed trial court to decide application under section 249-A, Cr.P.C. within one month.
